title: Kagiso Rabada

coverImage.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0 International license.

summary: Kagiso Rabada is a South African international cricketer who plays all formats of the game. Rabada, who is known by the nickname KG, is a fast bowler and plays domestic cricket for the Highveld Lions.

value.label: Kagiso Rabada
Johannesburg, South Africa
6ft 1in
KG
South African
Right Arm Fast
Kagiso Rabada is a left-handed, right-arm fast bowler.

image.altText: Style of play for Kagiso Rabada

value.label: Rabada made his debut for the Gauteng in the CSA Provincial One-Day Competition against Border in December 2013.
Rabada made his Twenty20 International debut for South Africa against Australia on 5 November 2014.
The Australia national cricket team is the joint oldest team in Test cricket history, having played in the first ever Test match in 1877.

value.label: Rabada was chosen to represent South Africa's Under-19 side for the 2014 ICC Under-19 Cricket World Cup.
In April 2019, he was named in South Africa's squad for the 2019 Cricket World Cup.

The ICC Cricket World Cup is the international championship of One Day International cricket. The event is organised by the sport's governing body, the International Cricket Council, every four years, with preliminary qualification rounds leading up to a finals tournament.

image.altText: Image of ICC Cricket World Cup

value.label: In February 2017, Rabada was bought by the Delhi Daredevils team for the 2017 Indian Premier League for INR 50 million.
The Delhi Capitals are a franchise cricket team that represents the city of Delhi in the Indian Premier League (IPL).

value.label: In July 2018 during the first test against Sri Lanka, Rabada is the youngest ever bowler to take 150 wickets in Test cricket

image.altText: In July 2018 during the first test against Sri Lanka, Rabada is the youngest ever bowler to take 150 wickets in Test cricket
image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: In 2018, He took the most wickets in Tests by any bowler, with 52 dismissals.

image.altText: In 2018, He took the most wickets in Tests by any bowler, with 52 dismissals.

facts.label: South Africa National Cricket team (2014- present)

value.label: The South African national cricket team, nicknamed the Proteas is administered by Cricket South Africa. South Africa is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test, One Day International (ODI) and Twenty20 International (T20I) status.

image.altText: Picture of South Africa national cricket team

value.label: The Delhi Capitals are a franchise cricket team that represents the city of Delhi in the Indian Premier League (IPL).
